pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:0.5: 64. The training rule on what is grave
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.2: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had committed an offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.3: He told his brother’s student about this,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.5: Soon afterwards another monk also committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. He asked the Sangha for probation,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.7: While he was on probation, he saw Upananda’s brother’s student and said to him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.8: “I’ve committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. I asked the Sangha for probation, which I got. I’m now undergoing probation. Please remember me as such.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.9: “Do others who have committed this offense need to do the same?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.11: “Venerable Upananda committed this offense and told me not to tell anyone.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.14: That monk then told other monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.15: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.16: “How can a monk knowingly conceal a monk’s grave offense?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.17: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.20: “… Foolish man, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.21: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.22: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:1.23.1: ‘If a monk knowingly conceals a monk’s grave offense, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.8: he knows by himself or others have told him or the offender has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.10: the four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.1.12: thinking, “If they find out about this, they’ll accuse him, remind him, scold him, censure him, humiliate him; I won’t tell,” then by the mere fact of giving up his duty, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.1: If it is a grave offense, and he perceives it as such, and he conceals it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.2: If it is a grave offense, but he is unsure of it, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.3: If it is a grave offense, but he perceives it as minor, and he conceals it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.4: If he conceals a minor offense, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.5: If he conceals the grave or minor misconduct of one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.6: If it is a minor offense, but he perceives it as grave, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.7: If it is a minor offense, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.2.8: If it is a minor offense, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.2: if he does not tell because he thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.3: if he does not tell because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.4: if he does not tell because he thinks the person he is telling about is cruel and harsh and that he might become a danger to life or to the living of the spiritual life;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.5: if he does not tell because he does not see any suitable monks;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.6: if he does not tell, but not because he wants to conceal;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.7: if he does not tell because he thinks the other person will be known through his own actions;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc64:2.3.10: The fourth rule, the training rule on what is grave, is finished.
